meanings.definition: Assume a posture or pose to convey a certain attitude or mood.
meanings.sent1: She attitudinises by standing tall and crossing her arms to appear confident.
meanings.sent2: He often attitudinises in front of the mirror, trying to look tough.
meanings.sent3: The cat attitudinises by arching its back and puffing up its fur to scare away the dog.
meanings.sent4: The actor attitudinises on stage, transforming into a completely different character.
meanings.sent5: The superhero attitudinises before the final battle, ready to face any challenge.

meanings.definition: Behave in a way that is intended to impress or deceive others.
meanings.sent1: He attitudinises by bragging about his accomplishments to make himself look better.
meanings.sent2: She attitudinises during job interviews to appear more experienced than she actually is.
meanings.sent3: The magician attitudinises by performing tricks to create an illusion of magic.
meanings.sent4: The politician attitudinises during speeches, trying to win over the crowd with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The con artist attitudinises to gain the trust of unsuspecting victims before scamming them.

meanings.definition: Display a particular attitude or mindset through one's actions or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The rebellious teenager attitudinises by rolling their eyes and sighing loudly.
meanings.sent2: He attitudinises his disapproval of the new rules by refusing to follow them.
meanings.sent3: The toddler attitudinises by stomping their feet when they don't get their way.
meanings.sent4: The artist attitudinises their creativity through bold and unconventional choices.
meanings.sent5: The leader attitudinises confidence and determination, inspiring others to follow their lead.
